main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a bright, fast-moving object in the sky over Blytheville, Arkansas on October 24, 1966.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be traveling at more than 1,800 miles per hour and at a very high altitude.
The object appeared to be divided in the center but remained intact as it moved from south to north and disappeared into the clouds.
The observer's son first spotted the object in the southwestern sky, and it was observed for approximately one minute.
Two B-52 aircraft from Blytheville Air Force Base were airborne in the local area at the time of the sighting, but the observer insisted the object was not an aircraft.
Based on the object's speed and flight path, the investigator concluded the velocity was considerably in excess of the observer's estimate and any aircraft then in production.
sighted object: a bright, fast-moving object in the sky
